author: @TechLord79
text: On Windows file systems are not case-sensitive except for file/folder creation. And using '/' instead of '\' only works because of some historic POSIX/C compatibility.os.newline() is new in Python 3 and also worth a look (if I remembered the name correctly). Thanks for the vid :-)
